mdRecord.dcterms:title: Horse teeth clacker P600088
mdRecord.dcterms:description:
We assess age by examining the lower incisor teeth, as they are easily accessible when the mouth is opened. In this model, most teeth are absent; however, if you look closely, you can see that the two little tiny parts of the central deciduous (baby) incisors have just begun to erupt from the gumâ€”typically around 6 days of age. These teeth appear small and white. Note the oval-shaped chewing (occlusal) surface.
Based on the description above, estimate the age of this specimen.
You can compare this young foal's decideous "milky" teeth to other adult ones like model P6000069.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Horses--Aging
Horses--Age determination
